s.text: Bush outlined his "core, conservative principles"--"limited government," "low taxes," "free and fair trade," "local control of schools," "strong families," and "personal responsibility."
"Some have said, 'Well, you're gonna be too late in some state,' " he lamented.
Bush's personnel moves serve him particularly well on social issues.
Yet Bush remains clueless about many national issues and, on others, he knows he can only lose votes by being pinned down.
Bush outlined his "core, conservative principles"--"limited government," "low taxes," "free and fair trade," "local control of schools," "strong families," and "personal responsibility."

Bush outlined his "core, conservative principles"--"limited government," "low taxes," "free and fair trade," "local control of schools," "strong families," and "personal responsibility."
A reporter asked him about conservative opponents who associate him with his father's moderation.
When asked about specific issues, he referred back to his principles.
